user.title: General Settings
user.description: Welcome! This integration calculates a weighted energy price based on your grid, solar, and battery usage. First, give your sensor a name.

grid_import.title: Grid Import Source
grid_import.description: How should we track the energy coming from the grid? You can use a sensor from your Energy Dashboard, any power (W) or energy (kWh) sensor, or a fixed value if you don't have monitoring.

grid_import_value.title: Grid Import Value
grid_import_value.description: Please select the sensor or enter the value for your grid import.

grid_price.title: Grid Price Source
grid_price.description: Where does the current price for grid electricity come from? Most users with dynamic tariffs use a price sensor here.

grid_price_value.title: Grid Price Value
grid_price_value.description: Please select the sensor or enter the fixed price in €/kWh.

solar.title: Solar Source
solar.description: How should we track your solar production? This is used to calculate the 'free' or lower-cost portion of your energy mix.

solar_value.title: Solar Value
solar_value.description: Please select the sensor or enter the value for your solar production.

solar_price.title: Solar Price Source
solar_price.description: What is the cost of your solar energy? Usually this is 0.0, but some users might want to account for missed feed-in compensation or production costs.

solar_price_value.title: Solar Price Value
solar_price_value.description: Please select the sensor or enter the solar energy price in €/kWh.

battery_power.title: Battery Power Source
battery_power.description: Select the sensor that shows current battery power. Positive values should represent discharging (providing energy), and negative values should represent charging (storing energy).

battery_power_value.title: Battery Power Value
battery_power_value.description: Please select the sensor or enter the value for battery power (W or kW).

battery_energy.title: Battery Energy Source
battery_energy.description: Finally, we need to know the current amount of energy stored in your battery. This is used as the denominator to track the average cost of the stored energy.

battery_energy_value.title: Battery Energy Value
battery_energy_value.description: Please select the sensor that provides the current state of charge in kWh.
